Krypton is a war-game presented by OverTheWire.org that aims at teaching about Cryptography. During this series we will look various Cryptography techniques and how to approach a problem/challenge involving Cryptography. In this writeup we will solve Krypton level0 to gain password for Krypton level 1.

The prompt for level 0 is -



The prompt states that the password for is encoded in base64 and we need to decode it and use it as the password for krypton1.

There are various online tools available to decode base64 to ascii, I use base64decode.org as my goto online tool, using it to decode the encoded string we get the decoded password.



On the other hand, if you do not have internet access and have python installed, you can use the following code to decode a base64 encoded string.

from base64 import decodebytes

encoded_string = "S1JZUFRPTklTR1JFQVQ="
decoded_string = decodebytes(bytes(encoded_string.encode('utf-8'))).decode('utf-8')
print(f"Decoded string - {decoded_string}")




This small code will decode any base64 encoded string which has been encoded only once. A more exhaustive utility is present in the Github repository of this blog (View 'base64decoder.py' on Github) .

The password for krypton1 is: KRYPTONISGREAT
